definition: to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in

sentences.english: But now we are having two kinds of partings .
sentences.chinese: 但現在，我們對臨別卻有兩種不同的想法。

sentences.english: Interview etiquette extends beyond the goodbye hand-shake.
sentences.chinese: 面試禮儀不僅限於臨別握手。

sentences.english: He gave his friend a book as a go-away token.
sentences.chinese: 他送朋友一本書作爲臨別紀念。

sentences.english: That tape recorded the parting advice from her best friends.
sentences.chinese: 那盒卡帶上錄着好朋友給她的臨別贈言。

sentences.english: Spirit of body and mind gave abrupt parting advise to her boy friend.
sentences.chinese: 身心靈向她的男朋友給了突然的臨別贈言。

sentences.english: “Enjoy the stalking, ” was his farewell remark.
sentences.chinese: “享受盯梢追捕的樂趣”，他臨別致辭。

sentences.english: I also use this jig for my parting tool.
sentences.chinese: 我也用這個，我臨別工具夾具。

sentences.english: Are you well, my Emma?' was Mrs. Weston's parting question.
sentences.chinese: “你身體好嗎，愛瑪？”韋斯頓太太臨別時問道。

sentences.english: According to his parting words, we won't see him again.
sentences.chinese: 從他臨別的話看來，我們是不會再見到他了。

sentences.english: He particularly warmed to her parting shot.
sentences.chinese: 他尤其欣賞她的臨別贈言。

sentences.english: Thank you for your going-away present. You shouldn't have done that.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝你贈給我的臨別禮品，你本不該這樣做的。

sentences.english: In his farewell address the Lord Jesus put the disciples' minds at ease.
sentences.chinese: 幸好主耶穌的臨別贈言，令門徒如釋重負。

sentences.english: We clubbed together to buy him a leaving present.
sentences.chinese: 我們共同出錢給他買了一個臨別禮物。

sentences.english: His parting request was for me to never forget what he taught me.
sentences.chinese: 他在臨別時，請我永遠不要忘記他所教給我的。

sentences.english: He remembered her parting kiss in the following years.
sentences.chinese: 以後的歲月中，他一直記着她臨別時的一吻。

definition: to warn/to urge/to exhort/to give instructions carefully and insistently
to warn repeatedly/to urge/to exhort again and again
on leaving/on the point of departure
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
to say good-bye/to bid sb farewell
